Recipe.Description: Crunchy, nutty, chocolatey toffee candy bites.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Sheet pan lined with parchment paper or buttered aluminum foil.

Method.Step: Add the butter to a large saucepan and heat over medium heat until the butter has melted.
Stir in the sugar, corn syrup, and water.
Stir and bring to a simmer.
Let the mixture simmer on low to medium heat for 30=45 minutes, or until it reaches 295-300Â° F. A slower simmer is better to prevent the butter fat from separating. Avoid stirring the mixture.
Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and spread out evenly. Let the mixture set for about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle the chocolate chips on top in an even layer and let sit for a few minutess.
Use an offset or rubber spatula to spread the melted chocolate chips out in an even and smooth layer.
Sprinkle the toasted pecans or Fleur de Sel on top, then let set for 1-2 hours or until completely cooled.
Once completely cooled, break into pieces and serve.
